definition:
If $\mathfrak{M}$ is a transitive model of set theory and $P$ is a
partial order then we can define a *forcing relation*:
$$p\Vdash_P \phi(\tau_1,\ldots,\tau_n)$$ ($p$ *forces*
$\phi(\tau_1,\ldots,\tau_n)$)

for any $p\in P$, where $\tau_1,\ldots,\tau_n$ are $P$- names.

Specifically, the relation holds if for every generic filter $G$ over
$P$ which contains $p$,
$$\mathfrak{M}[G]\vDash \phi(\tau_1[G],\ldots,\tau_n[G])$$

That is, $p$ forces $\phi$ if every of $\mathfrak{M}$ by a generic
filter over $P$ containing $p$ makes $\phi$ true.

If $p\Vdash_P \phi$ holds for every $p\in P$ then we can write
$\Vdash_P\phi$ to mean that for any generic $G\subseteq P$,
$\mathfrak{M}[G]\vDash\phi$.
